intro: Terebinthus multijuga, commonly known as the multijugate terebinth, is a shrub or small tree native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Burseraceae, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and produces yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its bark and resin have been historically used in traditional medicine and as a source of aromatic compounds. The species is adapted to dry, rocky environments and exhibits a slow growth rate.
